intro: Pimpinella flaccida, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, round fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella flaccida is often found in temperate regions and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
